meanings.definition: Assist in bringing forth or bringing about
meanings.sent1: She was midwifing the new project to completion.
meanings.sent2: The team was midwifing a solution to the problem.
meanings.sent3: The idea of midwifing a surprise party for her friend made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His guidance was like midwifing a seed into a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: Midwifing the plan into action required careful attention to detail.

meanings.definition: Help in the birth of a baby
meanings.sent1: The experienced midwife was midwifing the delivery smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She was midwifing the birth of her sister's first child.
meanings.sent3: The midwife joked that midwifing babies was her superpower.
meanings.sent4: Midwifing the baby into the world was a moment of pure joy.
meanings.sent5: The midwife's calm presence was crucial in midwifing the baby's arrival.

meanings.definition: Aid in the development or progress of something
meanings.sent1: His mentorship was midwifing the growth of the young entrepreneur.
meanings.sent2: The community was midwifing the construction of a new playground.
meanings.sent3: The volunteers were happily midwifing the charity event.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement was like midwifing a dream into reality.
meanings.sent5: Midwifing the project forward required teamwork and dedication.
